intro: Isoglossa justicioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Isoglossa justicioides is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
